title: GetGlobalAchievementPercentagesForApp is missing the same release checks as GetSchemaForGame
vulnerability_information:
`GetGlobalAchievementPercentagesForApp` API method can be used to reveal achievement names/percentages for games that have not been released yet.

This is not a problem with `GetSchemaForGame` method, which leads me to believe the other method is missing all the relevant checks.

https://api.steampowered.com/ISteamUserStats/GetGlobalAchievementPercentagesForApp/v2/?gameid=██████
https://api.steampowered.com/ISteamUserStats/GetSchemaForGame/v1/?appid=████

`GetGlobalAchievementPercentagesForApp` should have the same release state checks as `GetSchemaForGame` as to not leak achievement names.

## Impact

This can be used to reveal and leak work-in-progress achievements for games that have not been released yet.

https://api.steampowered.com/ISteamUserStats/GetSchemaForGame/v1/?appid=%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88

GetGlobalAchievementPercentagesForApp should have the same release state checks as GetSchemaForGame as to not leak achievement names.

Impact

Kind regards,
@orangeband

activities.message:
Hi @xpaw 

Thank you for the submission. Although I understand what is being provided, I am having a hard time understanding the security risk involved here. Can you explain as to how an attacker would be able to use/abuse this type of information against another user?

Thank you,
@orangeband

activities.message:
This API endpoint is leaking partner data (achievements and their unlock percentages) for unreleased games, which normally have achievements hidden (can't get the achievement schema, can't view achievements in profile, can't view global stats on the community site).

This is an issue because this reveals work-in-progress stuff█████████

All these leaks and rumors are based on the fact that `GetGlobalAchievementPercentagesForApp` is missing extra release checks and as a result leaks the achievement internal names.
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Hi @xpaw 

After reviewing this some more, there does not seem to be any security risk and/or security impact as a result of the behavior you are describing. Being able to view game achievements early does not hinder any security status as the information is to be accessible soon after. It is no different than when other gaming companies have their trophy/achievements listed earlier on.

If you are able to leverage this into a practical exploitation scenario, we will be happy to reevaluate this report, but at this time, it does not present a significant security risk. As such, we will be closing this as Informative.

Thank you and happy hunting,
@orangeband

activities.message:
I still consider this to be a problem, game developers do not expect their achievements to be leaked before the game is fully released.

Here's an example of ███████. 
https://api.steampowered.com/ISteamUserStats/GetGlobalAchievementPercentagesForApp/v2/?gameid=█████

You can not find achievement data for this game anywhere else (other apis, store page, community page, etc).

activities.message:
We've had a game developer contact us because their achievement names were public early, due to this API not having release checks. I still believe this is information disclosure that should be fixed.

For example a game that releases in 2020: https://api.steampowered.com/ISteamUserStats/GetGlobalAchievementPercentagesForApp/v2/?gameid=████
(they have changed the names themselves after they realized it leaks publicly).

activities.message: On review, this does not look to have been triaged correctly. We may update this again based on our findings, but for now I'm marking it Triaged.

activities.message: Thank you again for your report. We've got the fix implemented and staged for a future server update. We're paying the bounty now, with a bonus to reflect the business impact above the technical severity.

activities.message:
Hi @xpaw, 

We have determined that this issue is now resolved. If you’re still able to reproduce this issue, please let us know and we will investigate further. 

Please request a disclosure and the team will review and approve it.

Thanks!
@nasr0x01
